page.title: 01E. of Port William, Galloway
page.content: Area contains about 6 farms, partly arable & mainly rough grazing with some areas of wet-lands & scrubland. The contours are gently undulating with no high peaks & contains some very flat areas. The rough grazing supports cattle with some sheep. The higher ground has some rock outcrops of no great size. There are standing stones, a set of cup & ring marked carvings on private farmland (Drumtrodden Farm) off the A714 about a mile East of Port William. The SW corner of the area embraces part of the White Loch of Myrton which is surrounded by coniferous with some scattered deciduous trees. The roads traversing the area are very well metalled & in good repair, but apart from farm tracks, there are no public footpaths. Some stone-walling around fields but not in lower marshy areas.
